poem:
Title: "A Journey in Reality's Vein"

In the carpentry of cheap lies,
A politician preens, rousing
Through city's winding arteries.
Oh, the bus daubed in guile,
Red as a deceit in full bloom,
Painted with slogans, evoking zeal.
Harman's pink, Anderson's dare,
Through city streets they scare.
Yet, city still breathes, venerative and vile,
In the truths, Sunak fears to unveil.
